intro: Pleurothallis chicalensis, commonly known as the Chicalén orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its relatively compact size and unique floral structure. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
